text:
Ashitha Nagesh for Metro.co.uk Tuesday 21 Feb 2017 11:22 am The truck was speeding the wrong way (Picture: @uklanor / Twitter) 
A driver has been shot at after reportedly speeding towards Barcelona city centre in a lorry packed with gas cylinders. 
Gas canisters were thrown from the back of the vehicle during the high-speed chase, before officers opened fire on the truck and shot into the air. Man filmed dragging dog across ground behind his mobility scooter 
The truck driver was reportedly speeding the wrong way down a dual carriageway in Spain. It’s believed the vehicle was stolen. 
Officers are said to have rushed to the scene and surrounded the vehicle – some of whom were even armed with machine guns. 
The driver, who is thought to be a Swedish national, has now reportedly been arrested. 
According to Spanish media, at least one pedestrian was injured after being hit by a flying butane bottle.
